items.title: Consumer confidence is lower than expected as Wall Street braces for shutdown data blackout
bullets: • The Conference Board's headline confidence index registered a 94.2 reading, off 3.6 points from the August reading
• The reading was the lowest since April and comes with nonessential government operations slated to close at midnight
• The bureau's Job Openings and Labor Turnover report showed a slower pace in both hiring and total separations

items.title: CoreWeave stock climbs 13% after company lands $14 billion deal with Meta
bullets: • CoreWeave has agreed to provide Meta with $14.2 billion of artificial intelligence cloud infrastructure
• Meta has the option to "materially expand its commitment" for additional computing capacity through 2032
• The social media company has been pouring tens of billions of dollars into AI in recent months

items.title: Donald Trump addresses military leaders as Pete Hegseth declares war on diversity efforts – US politics live
bullets: • He claims Canada called him a couple of weeks ago to express interest in being part of his Golden Dome missile defense system
• Trump praises “beautiful paper” and how much he loves his own signature, so much so he refers to Joe Biden’s previous use of an autopen as “the autopen”

items.title: Here's JPMorgan Chase's blueprint to become the world’s first fully AI-powered megabank
bullets: • JPMorgan Chase is being "fundamentally rewired" for the coming artificial intelligence era
• The bank wants to provide every employee with AI agents, automate every behind-the-scenes process and have every client experience curated with AI concierges
• The project could have profound implications for the bank's employees, customers and shareholders

items.title: Flights in Afghanistan grounded after internet shutdown
bullets: • The Taliban has not given an official reason for the shutdown, but said it would last until further notice
• The internet has been severely affected by the government's decision to cut access to the internet
• The UN has called on the Taliban to fully restore the internet to Afghanistan

items.title: Michigan church shooting suspect bore a hatred of Mormon religion, locals say
bullets: • Four people have been killed in a car crash in Michigan
• The victims are believed to be the victims of the car crash
• Police say the victims were victims of a car bomb attack on the city
• The incident happened at the end of the day on Sunday

items.title: Chinese woman convicted after 'world's biggest' bitcoin seizure
bullets: • Chinese woman convicted after 'world's biggest' bitcoin seizure in the world
• She pleaded guilty at Southwark Crown Court of illegally acquiring and possessing the cryptocurrency
• The 47-year-old's guilty plea followed a seven-year probe into a global money laundering web

items.title: For Netanyahu, avoiding a peace deal may now be worse than agreeing one
bullets: • For Netanyahu, avoiding a peace deal may now be worse than agreeing one
• Netanyahu's far-right allies have threatened to leave – and possibly collapse – his government if he makes too many concessions in ending the war
• In return, he is dangling the prospect of a new, more peaceful future for the region

items.title: What is a government shutdown and why is this year’s threat more serious?
bullets: • The federal government is on the brink of a government shutdown
• Congress has yet to reach an agreement on a short-term funding deal
• A 34-day shutdown in 2018 resulted in the longest in the modern era
• The White House has instructed agencies to prepare for a shutdown

items.title: Government shutdown: 'Democrats should do the right thing,' Speaker Johnson says
bullets: • Democrats want to keep the government open for at least seven weeks
• They want an extension of the Affordable Care Act tax credits
• Those credits are due to expire at the end of the year
• Democrats say they will not pass a bill that would keep the federal government open

items.title: Hegseth reiterates 'warrior ethos' in remarks to top US generals
bullets: • US President Donald Trump is scheduled to speak at the end of the week
• He is expected to address the issue of gender equality in the United States
• The president will also address the US military in Washington, D.C., on Monday

items.title: Kash Patel allegedly gave New Zealand officials guns illegal to possess under local laws
bullets: • The FBI director gave the inoperable guns to New Zealand police and officials
• The guns were inoperably disassembled and had to be destroyed
• The weapons were part of a display at the FBI’s first standalone office in New Zealand

items.title: The most efficient Crosstrek ever? Subaru’s hybrid gets a bit rugged.
bullets: • The Subaru Crosstrek now shares a hybrid powertrain with the Forester SUV
• The hybrid system significantly works over the flat-four versus even current internal-combustion siblings
• Subaru builds the hybrids in Japan for all international markets, only Americans prefer going overboard on tacky plastic trim pieces

items.title: Hundreds of US women charged with pregnancy-related crimes since fall of Roe
bullets: • Of the 412 cases tracked by Pregnancy Justice, the vast majority took place in the US south
• Nearly 400 of the cases involved allegations of substance use during pregnancy
• In 16 cases, law enforcement charged women with homicide in 16 cases
• There is no national database of US arrest or court records, the group believes the tally is likely to be an undercount

items.title: The SUV that saved Porsche goes electric, and the tech is interesting
bullets: • Porsche has sold more than a million 911s since the model's introduction in 1963
• The Cayenne Electric is based on Volkswagen Group's Premium Platform Electric
• There's an all-new battery pack design, more efficient and powerful electric motors
• Inside, the cockpit is also new, with OLED screens for the main instrument panel and curved infotainment display

items.title: It's Amazon's turn to show off new devices: All eyes on Alexa+, Echo and Kindle
bullets: • Amazon's new Alexa+ device is set to be unveiled at 10 a.m
• ET on Tuesday
• The device is expected to be available for the first time in the fall
• The event is scheduled to be followed by a live stream of live videos from Amazon's YouTube channel

items.title: Entire Ukrainian family killed in Russian drone strike, officials say
bullets: • Couple and their two young sons, aged four and six, killed in Russian drone strike
• Bodies of the two children and their parents were later recovered from the wreckage
• Ukraine's air force said its units shot down 46 out of 65 Russian drones overnight

items.title: Scientists unlock secret to Venus flytrap’s hair-trigger response
bullets: • The Venus flytrap attracts its prey with a fruity scent
• When an insect lands on a leaf, it stimulates the sensitive trigger hairs that line the leaf
• When the pressure becomes strong enough to bend those hairs, the plant snaps its leaves shut
• The plant detects the first "action potential" but doesn't snap shut right away, waiting until a second zap confirms the presence of prey

items.title: The UN mission appeals to the Taliban to restore internet access in Afghanistan
bullets: • The outage was the first nationwide shutdown since the Taliban returned to power in August 2021
• Earlier this month, several provinces lost their fiber-optic connections after Taliban leader Hibatullah Akhundzada issued a decree banning the service
• The disruption threatened economic stability and deepened one of the world's worst humanitarian crises, U.N
• says

items.title: With therapy hard to get, people lean on AI for mental health. What are the risks?
bullets: • ChatGPT, a chatbot developed by Open AI, has 700 million weekly users
• Chatbot chatbots are drawing in people priced out of therapy, burned by bad experiences, or just curious to see if a machine might be a helpful guide

items.title: Government shuts down tonight barring a deal. And, U.S. military leaders gather in VA
bullets: • Government shuts down tonight barring a deal to fund the government
• Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth meets with top U.S
• military leaders in Quantico, Va., to discuss budget negotiations
• NPR's Deirdre Walsh says she doesn't see any way to avoid a government shutdown

items.title: Germany thrived in the first China Shock. But the next one could prove catastrophic.
bullets: • Germany thrived in the first China Shock, but the next one could prove catastrophic
• The VDMA represents thousands of German companies that manufacture industrial machines and equipment
• In the past six months alone, production is down 4.5 percent
• Exports are nose-diving, job cuts and furloughs are mounting

items.title: Memphis and Portland, Ore. brace for troops. Why Chicago might be next
bullets: • President Trump has proposed sending troops to Chicago as part of a broader effort to address violent crime in various cities
• Meanwhile, Memphis and Portland, Ore
• prepare for the arrival of National Guard troops
• Illinois Gov
• JB Pritzker said he received word that the Department of Homeland Security has asked the Defense Department for about 100 military personnel

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
bullets: • Namibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of Etosha national park
• The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros
• The fire had been burning since 22 September and had caused extensive ecological damage

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: NoViolet Bulawayo wins the Best of Caine award
bullets: • Best of Caine Prize for African Writing is awarded for a short story
• The story examines the lives of a group of children in Budapest, Hungary
• The winner of the award will be announced at the end of the month
• The award was handed out at the British Library in London today

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda expected to batter parts of the southeastern U.S. this week
bullets: • Parts of the U.S
• are expected to be hit by Tropical Storm I-Bahamas
• The storm is expected to bring heavy rain to parts of the country
• Parts of South Carolina, Florida and Georgia are in the path of the storm
• The hurricane is a tropical depression

items.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
bullets: • President Trump suggested that taking acetaminophen during pregnancy is linked to autism in children
• Doctors disagree and say there's no strong evidence for that
• Tylenol could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it
• NPR's pharmaceuticals correspondent, Sydney Lupkin, joins us in the comments

items.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
bullets: • Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite' The rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth get a moment to shine
• At the Cincinnati Observatory later today, collectors will be showing off some of their treasures

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: This tiny butterfly has the most chromosomes of any animal on Earth
bullets: • This tiny butterfly has the most chromosomes of any animal on Earth
• Unlike duplication, its chromosomes split apart, reshaping its genome in surprising ways
• Discovery sheds light on evolution, conservation, and even cancer research
• The Atlas blue butterfly is increasingly threatened by climate change and human impact

items.title: Trump obtains another settlement as YouTube agrees to pay $24.5 million
bullets: • Google owner Alphabet agrees to pay $24.5 million to settle lawsuit filed by President Trump in 2021
• Trump sued YouTube over his account being suspended after January 6, 2021, attack on US Capitol
• Trump directed $22 million to be contributed to the Trust for the National Mall, a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt entity, to support the construction of the White House State Ballroom

items.title: Another setback for Firefly Aerospace’s beleaguered rocket program
bullets: • The booster stage for Firefly Aerospace's next Alpha rocket was destroyed Monday in a fiery accident on the company's test stand in Texas
• Engineers were testing the rocket before shipment to Vandenberg Space Force Base, California, to prepare for launch later this year
• The rocket was undergoing test-firings of the booster's four kerosene-fueled engines

items.title: Astronomers stunned as fiery auroras blaze on a planet without a star
bullets: • Astronomers stunned as fiery auroras blaze on a planet without a star
• The James Webb Telescope has revealed fierce auroras, storms, and unchanging sand-like clouds
• These insights are pushing the boundaries of our understanding of alien atmospheres and exoplanet weather

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
bullets: • President Andry Rajoelina has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts
• The UN says 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in three days of demonstrations
• Thousands of people have marched in the capital Antananarivo since demonstrations began last week

items.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
bullets: • The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in Namibia's north, on 22 September
• The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park was to blame
• It said 49 soldiers were being deployed to fight the fires and a further 500 on Sunday

items.title: West Africans deported from US to Ghana ‘dumped without documents in Togo’
bullets: • Eight to 10 west African nationals have been forcibly sent by Ghana to Togo, bypassing a formal border crossing, and then left on the street without passports
• Up to 28 people have arrived in the west African nation from the US so far in the deportation programme

items.title: Scared of spiders? Some former arachnophobes now are keeping jumping spiders as pets
bullets: • Thousands of jumping spiders are being flooded with requests from people who want to keep them as pets
• Social media videos of the spiders' antics have been viewed millions of times on YouTube
• Some women are trying to overcome their fear of spiders, while others are simply enchanted by their unexpected cuteness

items.title: Hubble finds a hybrid galaxy with a mysterious and violent past
bullets: • Hubble finds a hybrid galaxy with a mysterious and violent past
• NGC 2775 lies 67 million light-years away in the constellation Cancer (The Crab) Blending features of spirals, ellipticals, and lenticulars, its structure may be the result of past galactic mergers

items.title: Earth was born dry until a cosmic collision made it a blue planet
bullets: • Earth was born dry until a cosmic collision made it a blue planet
• Initially, the planet was barren and inhospitable, missing water and carbon compounds
• A colossal collision with Theia likely changed everything, bringing the essential ingredients for life
• Study highlights that habitability may hinge on rare chance events

items.title: Black hole discovery confirms Einstein and Hawking were right
bullets: • New observations of a merger of two black holes confirm decades-old predictions by Albert Einstein, Stephen Hawking and Roy Kerr
• Scientists tracked the complete cosmic collision, confirming that black holes are defined by mass and spin
• They also gained stronger proof that a black hole’s event horizon only grows, echoing thermodynamic laws

items.title: Ring launches upgraded cameras with ‘Retinal Vision’ 4K recording
bullets: • Amazon announced a slew of 2K and 4K doorbells and cameras during its fall hardware event
• The new $179.99 Ring Wired Doorbell and $59.99 Indoor Cam Plus both offer 2K resolution
• There’s also a ton of 4K Ring cameras with up to 10 times zoom

items.title: SteelSeries Arctis Nova Elite review: $599 for premium, pricey perfection
bullets: • SteelSeries has created a category of luxury gaming headsets that doesn't really exist right now
• The Nova Elite has hi-res wireless audio, carbon fiber speaker drivers, a metal frame, and the ability to simultaneously stream audio from a PC, Xbox, and PlayStation
• But is $599.99 too much, even for the best gaming headset?

items.title: Amazon’s September 2025 hardware event: all the news and announcements
bullets: • Amazon will kick off its 2025 fall hardware event at 10AM ET / 7AM PT on September 30th
• There will be at least two new Echos, a new color Kindle, and some kind of TV hardware
• Amazon might also share new information about Alexa Plus, its AI-powered revamp of Alexa that launched earlier this year

items.title: Amazon event live blog: we’re here for new Echos, Kindles, and more
bullets: • We're at Amazon’s fall 2025 hardware event in New York City
• The company is set to announce a bunch of new gadgets ahead of the holidays
• Amazon CEO Andy Jassy promised “beautiful” new hardware back in February

items.title: Google Drive adds AI to detect ransomware before it spreads
bullets: • Google Drive is adding an AI model trained on “millions of real-world ransomware samples” The feature is rolling out in open beta starting today
• When the tool detects potentially malicious activity, you’ll get a notification and be able to roll back your files

items.title: CNN Political Briefing
bullets: • CNN Political Director David Chalian takes you inside the latest developments with insight and analysis from the key players in politics
• Suzan DelBene (D-WA) is laser-focused on re-capturing the House in 2026
• The race for New Jersey governor could be the sleeper contest of the year

items.title: The Axe Files with David Axelrod
bullets: • The Axe Files with David Axelrod is a series of revealing interviews with key figures in the political world
• This week marks the final episode of the series of interviews with Axelrod's friend, US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel
• Scott Jennings is well known as a conservative firebrand on CNN

items.title: Margins of Error
bullets: • This season on Margins of Error, Harry teases out big ideas like what accents say about where we live, how much money it takes to be happy, and whether the U.S
• should finally switch to the metric system
• Harry talks to some very smart people who are doing their best to optimize the way we travel
